page.title: 19Senior Citizens/The Disabled
page.content: People in this category live in specially designed bungalows with one or two bedrooms. The bungalows are arranged around a courtyard with a communal garden which is tended by the local authority. The occupants of the bungalows are visited daily by a warden who checks their welfare and will call a doctor if needed or do the shopping if they cannot get out. Milk, newspapers and post are delivered daily and the rent is collected weekly by a collector. Some residents who are very old or disabled have a home help. That is a lady who does the household chores. Close by thereis a community centre for the residents where they can, meet, chat and play bingo, dominoes and cards. Most residents enjoy their new homes because they have companionship and feel secure with a warden looking after them.
